output_list.reason: The mintToken function has an integer overflow that allows the owner to set the balance of an arbitrary user to any value.
The transferFrom function allows users to transfer tokens to any address, even if they do not have enough tokens.
The sell function has an integer overflow that allows users to buy a very large amount of tokens, causing a denial of service.
The buy function has an integer overflow that allows users to buy a very large amount of tokens, causing a denial of service.
The ToOwner function does not check if the contract has a non-zero balance, allowing any user to claim ownership and funds.
